meanings.definition: The act or process of returning to a previous state or condition.
meanings.sent1: After the storm, the garden's reversion to its lush green state was a welcome sight.
meanings.sent2: The reversion of the old building to its former glory brought joy to the community.
meanings.sent3: Seeing the cat's reversion to chasing its tail always brings a smile to my face.
meanings.sent4: The reversion of the city streets to a bustling marketplace was like stepping back in time.
meanings.sent5: The reversion of the clock to its original design made it a timeless piece of art.

meanings.definition: An instance of reverting back to an earlier form or state.
meanings.sent1: The sudden reversion of the software to an older version caused confusion among users.
meanings.sent2: His reversion to his childhood habits surprised his friends.
meanings.sent3: The reversion of the plant to its smaller size was unexpected but adorable.
meanings.sent4: The reversion of the town to a simpler time felt like a nostalgic dream.
meanings.sent5: The reversion of the painting to its original colors revealed hidden beauty.

meanings.definition: The right to possess or succeed to a property after the death of the current owner.
meanings.sent1: Her reversion to the family estate brought both joy and responsibility.
meanings.sent2: The reversion of the house to the eldest son was expected but still emotional.
meanings.sent3: The cat's reversion to the favorite armchair made it clear who was in charge.
meanings.sent4: The reversion of the heirloom ring to the youngest daughter symbolized a new beginning.
meanings.sent5: The reversion of the land to the original owner marked the end of a long legal battle.
